summary: This document appears to be a series of email or text message exchanges from July 24, 2019, discussing the refusal of a psychologist to complete a Suicide Risk Assessment (SRA) or competency report for an inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. The context suggests this may relate to Jeffrey Epstein, who was in custody at that facility and died on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Elissa
persons.context: Appears to be a staff member at the Metropolitan Correctional Center involved in a discussion about who should complete a Suicide Risk Assessment (SRA) or competency report for an inmate.

events.title: Discussion about Suicide Risk Assessment refusal
events.description: Email/text exchanges discuss a psychologist refusing to complete a Suicide Risk Assessment (SRA) or competency report for an inmate, with staff debating who should perform the assessment.

locations.name: Metropolitan Correctional Center
locations.address: 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
locations.context: Federal Bureau of Prisons facility where the discussed inmate was held; Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated here at this time.

keyFacts: The document contains internal communications from July 24, 2019, regarding a Suicide Risk Assessment (SRA) for an inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
A psychologist is refusing to complete the SRA or competency report, leading to staff discussions about who should perform the assessment.
The timing (July 24, 2019) is significant as it occurs just weeks before Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody at the same facility on August 10, 2019.
The document references 'closest to the incident' suggesting the assessment relates to a recent event involving the inmate.
The correspondence involves Bureau of Prisons staff at the Chief Psychologist level discussing protocol and responsibility for inmate assessments.
